file_content.text: You want something? I'm not the girl for you--I promise.
I'm getting bored now, Blade.
Not that I'm complaining, but don't we have a job to do?
You've been all over town, racking up quite a body count. And I know what you did to Karrels.
You're after something bigger than Nem'ro. I'm not sure what, and I'm not sure why--but I want in on it.
Fine. I'm sure we can work something out.
All right....
I knew we could get along. So where do we start?
I don't know what you're talking about.
You're deluded.
I'm an ambitious girl, and all I'm asking for is my cut. Think about it, and think about what I could do for you.
Allow me to respond to that.
You just made your last mistake, Kaliyo.
This is the end for you.
I think I've got a few mistakes left in me. Too bad you don't want to be a part of them.
Hold a moment, agent. Violence may not be necessary.
Hmm... what's this, now?
We know who you are, Kaliyo Djannis. And we are willing to offer you a deal.
Agent, please stay ready. If the alien refuses to accept our terms, you may kill her.
If she so much as twitches, I'll put her down.
Gladly.
Cute accent. That a challenge, then?
This should be interesting.
Let's see what happens.
You've got a cute accent, there.
I suggest you listen to what the man says.
Pay attention, Kaliyo.
Oh, I'm listening. Cute accent, though.
I am Keeper. I represent Imperial Intelligence, as does my operative. We are aware of your activities on Rattatak, Ord Mantell and Brentaal Four, as well as your... affiliations.
Your skills could prove useful, and we are willing to offer you a place in our ranks. You would become a very well-paid servant of the Empire.
I've heard worse propositions. What do you think, "agent"--you want me on your side?
You could be an asset to us. I won't object.
I see potential.
I don't see why not--sounds like fun to me.
We'll have a good time.
I was looking to trade up anyway... and I'm guessing I can ride you a ways before you break.
Frankly, killing you seems a lot simpler.
I'd rather just shoot you.
Might get the chance another time. But your boss just offered me a free ride, and who am I to say "no" to that?
Count me in. But call me a servant of the Empire again, and I'll bust your face.
Charming. We'll discuss the details later.
As for you, agent--Toth'lazhen is convinced that Fa'athra the Hutt is a major threat to business. Well done.
Now we must bring Toth'lazhen proof that Fa'athra has support from the Republic. The first step is to obtain a holodisc from Fa'athra's palace.
What does the Republic have to do with anything?
Why the Republic?
Toth'lazhen is no fool. If he believes Fa'athra is working with the Republic, he'll have to ally Nem'ro with the Empire to stay competitive.
Oh?
Back to work, then. The distraction was fun while it lasted.
Well, the party's over.
Indeed. You and Kaliyo can amuse yourselves later.
The disc contains holorecordings of all Fa'athra's dealings; the Hutt is too paranoid for his own good. You'll have to break into his archives to get it.
It'll mean lifting security codes off the palace overseers. Like you said--paranoid Hutt.
Noted.
Once you reach the archives, use this computer spike on the holodisc. It will be altered to show Fa'athra meeting with Republic officers. Then, bring the forgery to Toth'lazhen.
Forging evidence is risky business, Keeper.
This could easily go wrong.
We have decided that the risk is acceptable.
All this, just to gain the allegiance of a thug like Nem'ro.
It's a lot of trouble.
It's an inglorious business, isn't it?
A trivial task.
With Toth'lazhen convinced that his enemies are allied with the Galactic Republic, have no doubt--he will turn to us for help. We are in the endgame.
Kaliyo will accompany you on this mission and will act under your command.
Last time I went to Fa'athra's palace, I had so many adrenals in my system I was coming down for a week. This should be entertaining.
You better believe it. Good to have you along.
Oh, yes.
We're going to make an excellent team.
We're moving out.
Let's be clear--I don't trust you or your reasons for signing up.
I'm not happy.
Smart call.
Get the holodisc from Fa'athra's palace, use the computer spike to doctor it and report back when the altered disc has been delivered to Toth'lazhen. Keeper out.
So, this is where you've been hiding. Nice. Is the blood on the floor fresh, or did that come with the room?
What are you doing here, Kaliyo?
Explain yourself.
What? Not glad to see me?
You shouldn't have come here. We already played this game.
Bad move.
True. But the rules are a little different this time.
Just what I've always wanted--a pretty girl waiting for me at home.
[Flirt] Well, hello.
Nice, but that's not why I'm here. Not this time anyway.
Why do people keep breaking into my room?
Intruders? Again?
I can't speak for anyone else, but I thought it would be nice to talk privately.
I'll be keeping an eye on you, Blade.
Slow down, Blade. Stay with me awhile--we haven't had the chance to talk.
I'm Kaliyo. Nem'ro puts me in charge of the good stuff: his guns, his troops... the safety of his little palace. You can spare some time for me, right?
I have a minute. What can I do for you?
All right.
So sweet, and so polite. And here I figured you'd be eager to head back outside, blow the heads off a few locals.
Who am I to say "no" to a woman like you?
[Flirt] Sure, gorgeous.
Good answer. People who say "no" are never very interesting.
I'm in sort of a hurry right now. You'll have to make it quick.
I don't have much time.
I really can't. Sorry.
No.
Probably eager to get back outside--blow the heads off a few locals, see who's stupid enough to act tough. I'm more interesting. Promise.
You've got a nasty reputation, you know. I hear you went and murdered poor Dheno Rey right on this spot. What was that about, Blade?
He came after me; I just defended myself.
No idea.
Dheno and I go way back. He had it coming.
It was an old rivalry.
It's too bad. He had a pretty face before you messed with it.
Me, I'm betting you and Dheno had something else going on. You had a reason for coming to Nem'ro's house--maybe money, maybe power.
I don't know what you're talking about.
What do you mean?
Sure you don't. That corpse had nothing to do with you.
You've got a nasty reputation, you know. I can't help wondering: Why would the Red Blade finally visit the house of Nem'ro?
You've given it thought--why don't you tell me?
What do you think?
I think you want what everyone wants: money, power. Maybe stir things up a little.
Truth is, I'm just looking for fresh company.
[Flirt] I needed a break.
Is that right? Aw. You must get soft and lonely out there in space.
I'm just here to relax. I needed a safe haven--somewhere to lay low for a while.
It's a vacation.
Oh, well. I thought you might keep me busy, at least. Nem'ro's got me executing laborers, torching houses, and it gets dull.
You have a problem with me, talk to the Hutt. My business is with Nem'ro.
That's not your concern.
Maybe, but so long as Nem'ro and I are sharing a palace, his business is my business, too.
I like to think you'll be trouble, Blade. You'll be bloodthirsty. Treacherous. Because I could enjoy keeping an eye on a bloodthirsty, treacherous pirate.
I'm not going to be trouble.
You'll be disappointed.
Shh. Don't spoil the moment.
I could enjoy being watched.
Sounds like a good time.
Maybe we'll get along after all.
You've got a strange idea of fun, lady.
That's a little twisted.
I get bored easily. Even Hutt perversions get old after a while.
Do what you want. Just stay out of my way.
I'm warning you....
Touchy. I can deal with touchy.
If you are trouble, take your time. I'd hate to stick a blaster to your head or a slave collar around your neck before I've seen everything you can do.
That's all I wanted to say. You can go now.
It's been a pleasure, Kaliyo.
Thanks.
Of course it has.
You think you can make a threat like that and then just dismiss me?
It's not that easy.
I just did, didn't I?
Watch your back, Kaliyo.
Be careful.
I'll watch yours. You can watch mine.
Now's really not the time. Maybe later?
